text: Ghana is expected to compete at the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo. Originally scheduled to take place from 24 July to 9 August 2020, the Games have been postponed to 23 July to 8 August 2021, because of the COVID-19 pandemic. It will be the nation's fifteenth appearance at the Summer Olympics, having taken part in all but three editions since its debut (as the Gold Coast) in 1952. Ghana did not attend Montreal 1976 because of the African boycott, as well as the Moscow 1980, when the nation joined the United States-led boycott. ==Athletics== Ghanaian athletes achieved the entry standards, either by qualifying time or by world ranking, in the following track and field events (up to a maximum of 3 athletes in each event): ;Track & road events {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Quarterfinal !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Joseph Amoah |align=left|Men's 100 m |colspan=2 | | | | | | |-align=center |align=left|Men's 200 m | | |colspan=2 | | | | |} ;Field events {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Qualification !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Distance !Position !Distance !Position |-align=center |align=left|Nadia Eke |align=left|Women's triple jump | | | | |} ==Boxing== Ghana entered two boxers into the Olympic tournament. London 2012 Olympian Sulemanu Tetteh (men's flyweight) and rookie Samuel Takyi (men's featherweight) scored a box-off victory each to secure places in their respective weight divisions at the 2020 African Qualification Tournament in Diamniadio, Senegal. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !Round of 32 !Round of 16 !Quarterfinals !Semifinals !colspan=2|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Sulemanu Tetteh |align=left|Men's flyweight | | | | | | |-align=center |align=left|Samuel Takyi |align=left|Men's featherweight | | | | | | |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Olympics 2020 Category:2020 in Ghanaian sport
title: Ghana at the 2020 Summer Olympics
